p.s: Brian PollardsPollard's text Is the usefulness of unions coming to an end? The answer is yes is about the worker unions and was published on the 24 November 2011, in the Gulf News.
In this text he talks about how the unions and their goal hashave changed.
And rethinks the usefulness of unions in general.
In this text Brian Pollard uses lots of positive and negative connoted words to make his argumentation stronger.

For example, in the first line he says unions were the best thing that ever happened, but when his opinion changed you can notice a clear contrast to the words he uses, for example power and greed (l. 6-7).

He says that unions have become victims of their own success (l. 11) which is also connoted negative and makes the reader feel negative about unions in general, as if they were selfish and use the idea of helping workers as an image to make more money.
In line 15 he also uses your job and your union, with the personal adressaddress he catches the readersreader's attention and puts the reader in the employeesemployees' position.

In the end he kind of apealsappeals to the governments to take a hard look at the issue (l. 21) and makes his point clear, that in his eyes, unions are one of the major problems for the economic mess (l. 23) that we have.
With this end he let'slets the reader rethink everything they've read and makes them feel critical about unions, because he didn't mentionetedmentioned the good parts very often.
